<h2><a id="user-content-introduction" class="anchor" href="#introduction" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Introduction</h2>

<p>This document presents the results of peer assessments 1 of course <a href="https://class.coursera.org/repdata-004">Reproducible Research</a> on <a href="https://www.coursera.org">coursera</a>. This assignment makes use of data from a personal activity monitoring device. This device collects data at 5 minute intervals through out the day. The data consists of two months of data from an anonymous individual collected during the months of October and November, 2012 and include the number of steps taken in 5 minute intervals each day.</p>

<p>This document presents the results of the Reproducible Research's Peer Assessment 1 in a report using <strong>a single R markdown document</strong> that can be processed by <strong>knitr</strong> and be transformed into an HTML file.  </p>

<p>Through this report you can see that activities on weekdays mostly follow a work related routine, where we find some more intensity activity in little a free time that the employ can made some sport. </p>

<p>An important consideration is the fact of our data presents as a t-student distribution (see both histograms), it means that the impact of imputing missing values with the mean has a good impact on our predictions without a significant distortion in the distribution of the data.  </p>

<h2><a id="user-content-prepare-the-r-environment" class="anchor" href="#prepare-the-r-environment" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Prepare the R environment</h2>

<h2><a id="user-content-loading-and-preprocessing-the-data" class="anchor" href="#loading-and-preprocessing-the-data" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Loading and preprocessing the data</h2>

<p>This assignment makes use of data from a personal activity monitoring device. This device collects data at 5 minute intervals through out the day. The data consists of two months of data from an anonymous individual collected during the months of October and November, 2012 and include the number of steps taken in 5 minute intervals each day.  </p>

<h3><a id="user-content-load-the-required-data" class="anchor" href="#load-the-required-data" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Load the required data</h3>

<p>The following statement is used to load the data using <code>read.csv()</code>.</p>

<p><strong>Note</strong>: It is assumed that the file activity.csv is in the current working directory. File can be downloaded from <a href="https://d396qusza40orc.cloudfront.net/repdata%2Fdata%2Factivity.zip">here</a></p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">rdata</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> read.csv(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">'</span>activity.csv<span class="pl-pds">'</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">header</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>, <span class="pl-v">sep</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>,<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,
                  <span class="pl-v">colClasses</span><span class="pl-k">=</span>c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>numeric<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>character<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>numeric<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>))</pre></div>

<h3><a id="user-content-tidy-the-data-or-preprocess-the-data" class="anchor" href="#tidy-the-data-or-preprocess-the-data" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>tidy the data or preprocess the data</h3>

<p>We convert the <strong>date</strong> field to <code>Date</code> class and <strong>interval</strong> field to <code>Factor</code> class.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">rdata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">date</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> as.Date(<span class="pl-smi">rdata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">date</span>, <span class="pl-v">format</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>%Y-%m-%d<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
<span class="pl-smi">rdata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> as.factor(<span class="pl-smi">rdata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span>)</pre></div>

<p>Now, let us check the data using <code>str()</code> method:</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>str(<span class="pl-smi">rdata</span>)</pre></div>

<h2><a id="user-content-what-is-mean-total-number-of-steps-taken-per-day" class="anchor" href="#what-is-mean-total-number-of-steps-taken-per-day" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>What is mean total number of steps taken per day?</h2>

<p>Now here we ignore the missing values(<em>a valid assumption</em>).</p>

<p>We proceed by calculating the total steps per day.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">steps_per_day</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> aggregate(<span class="pl-smi">steps</span> <span class="pl-k">~</span> <span class="pl-smi">date</span>, <span class="pl-smi">rdata</span>, <span class="pl-smi">sum</span>)
colnames(<span class="pl-smi">steps_per_day</span>) <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>date<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>steps<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
head(<span class="pl-smi">steps_per_day</span>)</pre></div>

<ol>
<li>Now we make a histogram of the total number of steps taken per day, plotted with appropriate bin interval.</li>
</ol>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">steps_per_day</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">steps</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span> 
       geom_histogram(<span class="pl-v">fill</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>green<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">binwidth</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">1000</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span> 
        labs(<span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Histogram of Steps Taken per Day<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, 
             <span class="pl-v">x</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Number of Steps per Day<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Number of times in a day(Count)<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span> theme_bw() </pre></div>

<ol>
<li>Now we calculate the <strong><em>mean</em></strong> and <strong><em>median</em></strong> of the number of steps taken per day.</li>
</ol>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">steps_mean</span>   <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> mean(<span class="pl-smi">steps_per_day</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">steps</span>, <span class="pl-v">na.rm</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>)
<span class="pl-smi">steps_median</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> median(<span class="pl-smi">steps_per_day</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">steps</span>, <span class="pl-v">na.rm</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>)</pre></div>

<p>The mean is <strong><code>r format(steps_mean,digits = 8)</code></strong> and median is <strong><code>r format(steps_median,digits = 8)</code></strong>.</p>

<h2><a id="user-content-what-is-the-average-daily-activity-pattern" class="anchor" href="#what-is-the-average-daily-activity-pattern" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>What is the average daily activity pattern?</h2>

<p>We calculate the aggregation of steps by intervals of 5-minutes and convert the intervals as integers and save them in a data frame called <code>steps_per_interval</code>.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">steps_per_interval</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> aggregate(<span class="pl-smi">rdata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">steps</span>, 
                                <span class="pl-v">by</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-v">interval</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">rdata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span>),
                                <span class="pl-v">FUN</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">mean</span>, <span class="pl-v">na.rm</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>)
<span class="pl-c">#convert to integers</span>
<span class="pl-c">##this helps in plotting</span>
<span class="pl-smi">steps_per_interval</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> 
        as.integer(levels(<span class="pl-smi">steps_per_interval</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span>)[<span class="pl-smi">steps_per_interval</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span>])
colnames(<span class="pl-smi">steps_per_interval</span>) <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>interval<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>steps<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)</pre></div>

<ol>
<li>We make the plot with the time series of the average number of steps taken (averaged across all days) versus the 5-minute intervals:</li>
</ol>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">steps_per_interval</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">steps</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span>   
        geom_line(<span class="pl-v">color</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>orange<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">size</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>  
        labs(<span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Average Daily Activity Pattern<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Interval<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Number of steps<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>  
        theme_bw()</pre></div>

<ol>
<li>Now, we find the 5-minute interval with the containing the maximum number of steps:</li>
</ol>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">max_interval</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> <span class="pl-smi">steps_per_interval</span>[which.max(  
        <span class="pl-smi">steps_per_interval</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">steps</span>),]</pre></div>

<p>The <strong><code>r max_interval$interval</code><sup>th</sup></strong> interval has maximum <strong><code>r round(max_interval$steps)</code></strong> steps.</p>

<h2><a id="user-content-imputing-missing-values" class="anchor" href="#imputing-missing-values" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Imputing missing values:</h2>

<h3><a id="user-content-1-total-number-of-missing-values" class="anchor" href="#1-total-number-of-missing-values" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>1. Total number of missing values:</h3>

<p>The total number of missing values in steps can be calculated using <code>is.na()</code> method to check whether the value is mising or not and then summing the logical vector.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">missing_vals</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> sum(is.na(<span class="pl-smi">rdata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">steps</span>))
</pre></div>

<p>The total number of <strong><em>missing values</em></strong> are <strong><code>r missing_vals</code></strong>.</p>

<h3><a id="user-content-2-strategy-for-filling-in-all-of-the-missing-values-in-the-dataset" class="anchor" href="#2-strategy-for-filling-in-all-of-the-missing-values-in-the-dataset" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>2. Strategy for filling in all of the missing values in the dataset</h3>

<p>To populate missing values, we choose to replace them with the mean value at the same interval across days. In most of the cases the median is a better centrality measure than mean, but in our case the total median is not much far away from total mean, and probably we can make the mean and median meets.</p>

<p>We create a function <code>na_fill(data, pervalue)</code> which the <code>data</code> arguement is the <code>rdata</code> data frame and <code>pervalue</code> arguement is the <code>steps_per_interval</code> data frame.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-en">na_fill</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">data</span>, <span class="pl-smi">pervalue</span>) {
        <span class="pl-smi">na_index</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> which(is.na(<span class="pl-smi">data</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">steps</span>))
        <span class="pl-smi">na_replace</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> unlist(lapply(<span class="pl-smi">na_index</span>, <span class="pl-v">FUN</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">idx</span>){
                <span class="pl-v">interval</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">data</span>[<span class="pl-smi">idx</span>,]<span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span>
                <span class="pl-smi">pervalue</span>[<span class="pl-smi">pervalue</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span> <span class="pl-k">==</span> <span class="pl-smi">interval</span>,]<span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">steps</span>
        }))
        <span class="pl-smi">fill_steps</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> <span class="pl-smi">data</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">steps</span>
        <span class="pl-smi">fill_steps</span>[<span class="pl-smi">na_index</span>] <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> <span class="pl-smi">na_replace</span>
        <span class="pl-smi">fill_steps</span>
}

<span class="pl-smi">rdata_fill</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> <span class="pl-k">data.frame</span>(  
        <span class="pl-v">steps</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> na_fill(<span class="pl-smi">rdata</span>, <span class="pl-smi">steps_per_interval</span>),  
        <span class="pl-v">date</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">rdata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">date</span>,  
        <span class="pl-v">interval</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">rdata</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span>)
str(<span class="pl-smi">rdata_fill</span>)</pre></div>

<p>We check that are there any missing values remaining or not</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>sum(is.na(<span class="pl-smi">rdata_fill</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">steps</span>))</pre></div>

<p>Zero output shows that there are <strong><em>NO MISSING VALUES</em></strong>.</p>

<h3><a id="user-content-3-a-histogram-of-the-total-number-of-steps-taken-each-day" class="anchor" href="#3-a-histogram-of-the-total-number-of-steps-taken-each-day" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>3. A histogram of the total number of steps taken each day</h3>

<p>Now let us plot a histogram of the daily total number of steps taken, plotted with a bin interval of 1000 steps, after filling missing values.</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">fill_steps_per_day</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> aggregate(<span class="pl-smi">steps</span> <span class="pl-k">~</span> <span class="pl-smi">date</span>, <span class="pl-smi">rdata_fill</span>, <span class="pl-smi">sum</span>)
colnames(<span class="pl-smi">fill_steps_per_day</span>) <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>date<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>steps<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)

<span class="pl-c">##plotting the histogram</span>
ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">fill_steps_per_day</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">steps</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span> 
       geom_histogram(<span class="pl-v">fill</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>blue<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">binwidth</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-c1">1000</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span> 
        labs(<span class="pl-v">title</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Histogram of Steps Taken per Day<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, 
             <span class="pl-v">x</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Number of Steps per Day<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Number of times in a day(Count)<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span> theme_bw() 
</pre></div>

<h3><a id="user-content-calculate-and-report-the-mean-and-median-total-number-of-steps-taken-per-day" class="anchor" href="#calculate-and-report-the-mean-and-median-total-number-of-steps-taken-per-day" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Calculate and report the <strong>mean</strong> and <strong>median</strong> total number of steps taken per day.</h3>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-smi">steps_mean_fill</span>   <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> mean(<span class="pl-smi">fill_steps_per_day</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">steps</span>, <span class="pl-v">na.rm</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>)
<span class="pl-smi">steps_median_fill</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> median(<span class="pl-smi">fill_steps_per_day</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">steps</span>, <span class="pl-v">na.rm</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">TRUE</span>)</pre></div>

<p>The mean is <strong><code>r format(steps_mean_fill,digits = 8)</code></strong> and median is <strong><code>r format(steps_median_fill,digits = 8)</code></strong>.</p>

<h3><a id="user-content-do-these-values-differ-from-the-estimates-from-the-first-part-of-the-assignment" class="anchor" href="#do-these-values-differ-from-the-estimates-from-the-first-part-of-the-assignment" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Do these values differ from the estimates from the first part of the assignment?</h3>

</ol></li>

<h3><a id="user-content-what-is-the-impact-of-imputing-missing-data-on-the-estimates-of-the-total-daily-number-of-steps" class="anchor" href="#what-is-the-impact-of-imputing-missing-data-on-the-estimates-of-the-total-daily-number-of-steps" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>What is the impact of imputing missing data on the estimates of the total daily number of steps?</h3>

<p>As you can see, comparing with the calculations done in the first section of this document, we observe that while the mean value remains unchanged, the median value has shifted and virtual matches to the mean.  </p>

<p>Since our data has shown a t-student distribution (see both histograms), it seems that the impact of imputing missing values has increase our peak, but it's not affect negatively our predictions. </p>

<h2><a id="user-content-are-there-differences-in-activity-patterns-between-weekdays-and-weekends" class="anchor" href="#are-there-differences-in-activity-patterns-between-weekdays-and-weekends" aria-hidden="true"><svg aria-hidden="true" class="octicon octicon-link" height="16" role="img" version="1.1" viewBox="0 0 16 16" width="16"><path d="M4 9h1v1h-1c-1.5 0-3-1.69-3-3.5s1.55-3.5 3-3.5h4c1.45 0 3 1.69 3 3.5 0 1.41-0.91 2.72-2 3.25v-1.16c0.58-0.45 1-1.27 1-2.09 0-1.28-1.02-2.5-2-2.5H4c-0.98 0-2 1.22-2 2.5s1 2.5 2 2.5z m9-3h-1v1h1c1 0 2 1.22 2 2.5s-1.02 2.5-2 2.5H9c-0.98 0-2-1.22-2-2.5 0-0.83 0.42-1.64 1-2.09v-1.16c-1.09 0.53-2 1.84-2 3.25 0 1.81 1.55 3.5 3 3.5h4c1.45 0 3-1.69 3-3.5s-1.5-3.5-3-3.5z"></path></svg></a>Are there differences in activity patterns between weekdays and weekends?</h2>

<p>We do this comparison with the table with filled-in missing values.<br>
1. Augment the table with a column that indicates the day of the week<br>
2. Subset the table into two parts - weekends (Saturday and Sunday) and weekdays (Monday through Friday).<br>
3. Tabulate the average steps per interval for each data set.<br>
4. Plot the two data sets side by side for comparison.  </p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre><span class="pl-en">weekdays_steps</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">data</span>) {
    <span class="pl-smi">weekdays_steps</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> aggregate(<span class="pl-smi">data</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">steps</span>, <span class="pl-v">by</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-k">list</span>(<span class="pl-v">interval</span> <span class="pl-k">=</span> <span class="pl-smi">data</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span>),
                          <span class="pl-v">FUN</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">mean</span>, <span class="pl-v">na.rm</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">T</span>)
    <span class="pl-c"># convert to integers for plotting</span>
    <span class="pl-smi">weekdays_steps</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> 
            as.integer(levels(<span class="pl-smi">weekdays_steps</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span>)[<span class="pl-smi">weekdays_steps</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span>])
    colnames(<span class="pl-smi">weekdays_steps</span>) <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>interval<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>steps<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>)
    <span class="pl-smi">weekdays_steps</span>
}

<span class="pl-en">data_by_weekdays</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span>(<span class="pl-smi">data</span>) {
    <span class="pl-smi">data</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">weekday</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> 
            as.factor(weekdays(<span class="pl-smi">data</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">date</span>)) <span class="pl-c"># weekdays</span>
    <span class="pl-smi">weekend_data</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> subset(<span class="pl-smi">data</span>, <span class="pl-smi">weekday</span> <span class="pl-k">%in%</span> c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Saturday<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Sunday<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>))
    <span class="pl-smi">weekday_data</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> subset(<span class="pl-smi">data</span>, <span class="pl-k">!</span><span class="pl-smi">weekday</span> <span class="pl-k">%in%</span> c(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Saturday<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Sunday<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>))

    <span class="pl-smi">weekend_steps</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> weekdays_steps(<span class="pl-smi">weekend_data</span>)
    <span class="pl-smi">weekday_steps</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> weekdays_steps(<span class="pl-smi">weekday_data</span>)

    <span class="pl-smi">weekend_steps</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">dayofweek</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> rep(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>weekend<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, nrow(<span class="pl-smi">weekend_steps</span>))
    <span class="pl-smi">weekday_steps</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">dayofweek</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> rep(<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>weekday<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, nrow(<span class="pl-smi">weekday_steps</span>))

    <span class="pl-smi">data_by_weekdays</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> rbind(<span class="pl-smi">weekend_steps</span>, <span class="pl-smi">weekday_steps</span>)
    <span class="pl-smi">data_by_weekdays</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">dayofweek</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> as.factor(<span class="pl-smi">data_by_weekdays</span><span class="pl-k">$</span><span class="pl-smi">dayofweek</span>)
    <span class="pl-smi">data_by_weekdays</span>
}

<span class="pl-smi">data_weekdays</span> <span class="pl-k">&lt;-</span> data_by_weekdays(<span class="pl-smi">rdata_fill</span>)</pre></div>

<p>Below you can see the panel plot comparing the average number of steps taken per 5-minute interval across weekdays and weekends:</p>

<div class="highlight highlight-source-r"><pre>ggplot(<span class="pl-smi">data_weekdays</span>, aes(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">interval</span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-smi">steps</span>)) <span class="pl-k">+</span> 
        geom_line(<span class="pl-v">color</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>violet<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span> 
        facet_wrap(<span class="pl-k">~</span> <span class="pl-smi">dayofweek</span>, <span class="pl-v">nrow</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">2</span>, <span class="pl-v">ncol</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-c1">1</span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
        labs(<span class="pl-v">x</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Interval<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>, <span class="pl-v">y</span><span class="pl-k">=</span><span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Number of steps<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>) <span class="pl-k">+</span>
        theme_bw()
</pre></div>

<p>We can see at the graph above that activity on the weekday has the greatest peak from all steps intervals. But, we can see too that weekends activities has more peaks over a hundred than weekday. This could be due to the fact that activities on weekdays mostly follow a work related routine, where we find some more intensity activity in little a free time that the employ can made some sport. In the other hand, at weekend we can see better distribution of effort along the time.</p>
</article>
